text: [Music]
part of what we do in our work a study
leadership which we think about as
social influence and a relationship with
followers to motivate and inspire we're
also very concerned with the study of
authority which is the right to do work
it is acknowledging that a group an
entity has authorized us to be in a
particular space to work in certain ways
now we talk about inner work how we take
up that authority and we believe that
social identities impact how we take up
that authority we believe that who our
followers are will impact that as well
it is important to think about the
unconscious to understand the leader
followership relationship and to
understand choices that we make as
leaders and/or thinking about how
followers influence who we become in
that role so part of how we think about
it too is that leadership and authority
and that relationship with followership
is perceptual that it happens in a set
of processes that are not clearly
defined and must be understood by
thinking about both what is conscious
and what is unconscious so choices such
as who we hire who we include or exclude
persons for whom we vote who's on our
board consciously we have a name we have
a title and we have a place for them to
sit but unconsciously they occupy for us
particularly might perform on others
behalf or in collaboration with us so
when we think about it in all those ways
it does get complicated who's in the
room and who's not who is leading whom
and who is exercising leadership and/or
authority in particular ways so the
unconscious helps us respond to those
questions in ways that we hadn't thought
about before so sometimes it scares
people to think about the unconscious
but we don't get scared when we hear it
as things that are outside of our
awareness but we're really talking about
the same thing so something that was
said that you didn't really hear because
you didn't pay attention to it or what
have you would be something that for
example rests outside of your awareness
or motivations that we have things that
we wanted that we almost couldn't let
ourselves know about that rests in this
other space so with my students
sometimes I'll start with calling it out
of awareness dynamic
and then move into describing it as
unconscious dynamics because I just
think that everybody knows that there
are things that we are not on top of and
that's not so scary and then once you're
not as afraid you're open to learning
something new when we talk about what
we're not talking about it in the sort
of contemporary meaning only we're also
talking about that sort of blend of
consciousness on one hand and what is
unconscious
if woke were only a static process then
that would be great
what we do in our work is we make it
available as something that you study as
an ongoing process we have a collective
responsibility to be woke in the sense
of what is it that I still do not
understand about myself my behavior what
I'm bringing forward in a group in an
organization and in my most intimate
relationships yeah we work together for
quite some time
but yet we still discover things that
bring us to consciousness and it's often
out of that deepest unconscious
uncomfortable space that we discover
something new about who we are
